Sentece: In Group I, after release of the tourniquet, T1 and TOF recovery rate decreased significantly over a 10-min period (10% +/- 3 to 4% +/- 4 and 0.12 +/- 0.06 to 0.06 +/- 0.04, mean +/- SD, respectively); in Group II, T1 and TOF recovery rate increased significantly over a 10-min period following deflation of the tourniquet (10% +/- 6 to 14% +/- 7 and 0.10 +/- 0.03 to 0.18 +/- 0.02, respectively).

Sentece: After three incremental doses of rapacuronium, there was a longer time to recovery of T1/T0 = 25% after neostigmine compared with edrophonium (5.1 (1.0) vs 3.3 (1.3) min; P < 0.05) but more rapid recovery to T1/T0 = 75% (10.1 (2.9) vs 16.8 (10.1) min; P < 0.05) and T4/T1 = 0.7 (19.8 (6.3) vs 35.1 (10.4) min; P < 0.05).
